snippet: The federal government has granted Florida election officials access to a database of noncitizen residents for use in Republican-backed efforts to remove people who are not American citizens from voter registration rolls.
abstract: Department of Homeland Security grants Florida election officials access to a database of noncitizen residents for use in Republican-backed efforts to remove people who are not American citizens from voter registration rolls.
lead_paragraph: The federal government has granted Florida election officials access to a database of noncitizen residents for use in Republican-backed efforts to remove people who are not American citizens from voter registration rolls.

headline.seo: U.S. to Let Florida Use Homeland Security Data for Voter Check
headline.main: U.S. to Let Florida Use Its Data for Voter Check
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Let Florida Use Its Data for Voter Check
